page.title: 17Benfleet - The River Thames
page.content: As part of the new{River Thames}sea defences to ensure that the 1953 flood disaster would never happen again; a tidal flood barrier was built East of the road bridge onto{Canvey Island}. This is managed by the Anglian Water Authority.The barrier has three gates. The barrier was operational by 1984 and was opened by HRH Princess Margaret in that year. West of the flood barrier,the creek side environment has been improved by landscaping and the planting of trees and shrubs. When a road was built in the 1960's,the creek was diverted from its old course past the Hoy and Helmet public house and the remains of the old creek bed can be seen. Beyond this old channel to the West,are recreation grounds and a sewage works,all on re-claimed land.The creek has saltings which takes the tidal overflow.
